title: Write in Expanded Form
text: We start by writing out the expression in its expanded form: $${\left(-2\right)}^4=\left(-2\right) \left(-2\right) \left(-2\right) \left(-2\right)$$, and we will simplify $$\left(-2\right) \left(-2\right) \left(-2\right) \left(-2\right)$$ by performing multiplication three times.
speech: We start by writing out the expression in its expanded form:  parentheses negative 2  to the fourth is equal to negative 2 times negative 2 times negative 2 times negative 2 , and we will simplify  negative 2 times negative 2 times negative 2 times negative 2  by performing multiplication three times.
pacedSpeech: We start by writing out the expression in its expanded form:    negative 2  to the fourth is equal to negative 2 times negative 2 times negative 2 times negative 2
, and we will simplify   negative 2 times negative 2 times negative 2 times negative 2

title: First Multiplication
text: We now multiply the first $$\left(-2\right) \left(-2\right)$$ pair together and substitute the value back into the expression. What is $$\left(-2\right) \left(-2\right)$$?
speech: We now multiply the first  negative 2 times negative 2,  pair together and substitute the value back into the expression. What is , negative 2 times negative 2 ?
pacedSpeech: We now multiply the first   negative 2 times negative 2,
pair together and substitute the value back into the expression. What is  , negative 2 times negative 2

title: First Multiplication
text: $$2\times2=4$$, and since $$-2$$ and $$-2$$ have the same signs, our final answer is positive: $$\left(-2\right) \left(-2\right)=4$$.
speech: 2 times 2, is equal to 4 , and since  negative 2  and  negative 2  have the same signs, our final answer is positive: , negative 2 times negative 2 is equal to 4 .
pacedSpeech: have the same signs, our final answer is positive:  , negative 2 times negative 2 is equal to 4

title: Current Expression
text: Substituting $$4$$ back, the orignal expression now becomes $$4\left(-2\right) \left(-2\right)$$.
speech: Substituting  4  back, the orignal expression now becomes , 4 times negative 2 times negative 2 .
pacedSpeech: back, the orignal expression now becomes  , 4 times negative 2 times negative 2

title: Second Multiplication
text: $$4\times2=8$$, and since $$4$$ and $$-2$$ have different signs, our final answer is negative: $$4\left(-2\right)=-8$$.
speech: 4 times 2, is equal to 8 , and since  4  and  negative 2  have different signs, our final answer is negative:  4 times negative 2 is equal to negative 8 .
pacedSpeech: have different signs, our final answer is negative:   4 times negative 2 is equal to negative 8

title: Current Expression
text: Substituting $$-8$$ back, the orignal expression now becomes $$-8\left(-2\right)$$.
speech: Substituting  minus, 8  back, the orignal expression now becomes , negative 8 times negative 2 .
pacedSpeech: back, the orignal expression now becomes  , negative 8 times negative 2

title: Third Multiplication
text: $$8\times2=16$$, and since $$-8$$ and $$-2$$ have the same signs, our final answer is positive: $$-8\left(-2\right)=16$$.
speech: 8 times 2, is equal to 16 , and since  negative 8  and  negative 2  have the same signs, our final answer is positive: , negative 8 times negative 2 is equal to 16 .
